title: About me
text:
Sujan Balami PhD
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Restoration Ecology Group
Key Laboratory of Tropical Forest Ecology | Xishuangbanna Tropical Botanical Garden
Chinese Academy of Sciences




Professional summary
Highly motivated and results-driven ecologist with experience on plant and soil microbiome. Skilled in molecular techniques including next-generation sequencing (NGS) methods. Proficient in analyzing NGS data as well as phylogenetic analysis. Published research and review articles in SCI listed journals and gathered experience in meta-analysis. Have strong collaborative spirit and passionate about conducting innovative research that drives scientific breakthroughs.


Education
University of South Bohemia, Ceske Budejovice | Czech Republic | PhD in Botany
Tribhuvan University, Kathmandu | Nepal | MSc in Botany


Experience
Teaching Assistant | Tribhuvan University, Kathmandu | Nepal
Research Assistant | CzechGlobe, Czech Academy of Science | Czech Republic
Lab Technician | University of South Bohemia, Ceske Budejovice | Czech Republic




Contact
E-mail: balamisujan@gmail.com | sujanbalami@xtbg.ac.cn
Address: Menglun Town | Mengla County | Yunnan Province | China

title: Publications
text:
Main Author

How do root fungi of Alnus nepalensis and Schima wallichii recover during succession of abandoned land?
Soil fungal communities in abandoned agricultural land has not yet moved towards the seminatural forest.
Soil fungal communities across land use types.
Effects of invasive Ageratina adenophora on mycelial growth of some important soil fungi.
Effect of invasive Ageratina adenophora on species richness and composition of saprotrophic and pathogenic soil fungi.
Herbivory damage in native Alnus nepalensis and invasive Ageratina adenophora.
Sterilization effect of Ageratina adenophora invaded soil on root growth of native Schima wallichii.



Co-author

Strangler fig–host tree associations: Insights into the ecology and management of tropical urban green spaces
Combining critical transition indicator to compare the stable structure of epiphyte–host networks
Laetiporus sulphureus in the mid-hills of Central Nepal: ecology, ethnomycology and present status
Variation in carbon storage among tree species in the planted forest of Kathmandu, Central Nepal.
Comparative assessment of ethnobotany and antibacterial activity of Moringa oleifera Lam. in Nepal.
Peoples’ Perception on Invasive Alien Plant Species of Ramdhuni Municipality, Sunsari District, Eastern Nepal.
Nutritive value of some wild edible macrofungi from Devdaha, Rupandehi district, Nepal.
